settings.title: What's the big deal about microplastics

settings.takeaway_copy: Microplastics are small shards of plastic less than five millimeters long that occur as a result of plastic disposal and decomposition
Microplastics harm wildlife - from seabirds to fish - and move up the food chain to humans
We ingest microplastic from our water and food sources - consuming an average of 5 grams of plastic a week

settings.title: The Details
settings.good_news_1_copy: Major beauty brands have committed to discontinuing the use of microplastic beads in cosmetics and toiletries
settings.good_news_2_copy: Scientists have found a bacteria with sticky properties that can capture and remove microplastic from water
settings.good_news_3_copy: The Microbead-Free Waters Act of 2015 banned the production of rinse-off cosmetics containing plastic microbeads
settings.sources:
